Package game

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • game.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends javafx.application.Application
    This class controls the logic behind the game and calls the games draw functions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • collisionHandler

        public void collisionHandler​(Enemy enemy)
        Handles collision detection between the enemies and the player, and removes a life from both the player and the enemy if a collision is detected.
        Parameters:
        enemy - an enemy that the player might collide with.

      • updateScore

        public void updateScore​()
        Updates the score to the screen.

      • updateScore

        public void updateScore​(int value)
        Adds a value to the score and updates it on the screen.
        Parameters:
        value - what will be added to the score.

        public void updateLives​()
        Updates the score to the screen.

      • updateLives

        public void draw​()
        This runs every frame to update the game graphics.

      • addEnemy

        public void addEnemy​(int type)
        Creates a new enemy with a random size and position and adds it to the games enemies list.
        Parameters:
        type - value for the enemy type which is sent to the Enemy constructor.

      • addBackObj

        public void addBackObj​(int type)
        Creates a new background object with random size, position and velocity based on type, and adds it to the relevant background object list.
        Parameters:
        type - type of background object, 0 being a star, and 1 - 8 being different planets.

      • addInitialBackObj

        public void addInitialBackObj​()
        Creates initial background objects of type 0 (star) for starting a new game.

      • addEnemyChildren

        public void addEnemyChildren​()
        Spawns small enemies from the boss, and draws them underneath it.

      • newGame

        public void newGame​()
        Resets all the game conditions to get ready for a new game.

      • addEventHandler

        public void addEventHandler​(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
        Adds a keyboard input event handler to the scene.
        Parameters:
        scene - The scene to add the event handler.

      • restartGame

        private void restartGame​()
        Restarts the game.

        public void exitGame​()
        Exits game.

        public void resumeGame​()
        Resumes the game.

      • continueGame

        public void continueGame​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Continues the game from the moment when it was ended when last time playing.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - Gets the mouseEvent and send it to the startGame method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws an Exception (if any) to handle it elsewhere.

      • startGame

        public void startGame​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method loads the game interface from FXML, handles menu button actions, sets the initial game variables and starts the game.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - Used to find the Application Stage.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws an Exception (if any) to handle it elsewhere.
